meanings.definition: The production of a sense impression relating to one sense or part of the body by stimulation of another sense or part of the body.
meanings.sent1: Her synaesthesis allowed her to taste colors and see sounds.
meanings.sent2: The artist experienced synaesthesis, hearing music and seeing vibrant hues.
meanings.sent3: During the concert, his synaesthesis made him believe the music was painting the walls.
meanings.sent4: In her mind, synaesthesis was like a magical bridge connecting different senses.
meanings.sent5: The synaesthesis of the fireworks display was like a symphony of light and sound.

meanings.definition: A sensation produced in one modality when a stimulus is applied to another modality, as when the hearing of a certain sound induces the visualization of a certain color.
meanings.sent1: His synaesthesis made him associate numbers with specific colors.
meanings.sent2: The synaesthesis she experienced made her see shapes when she heard music.
meanings.sent3: The synaesthesis of tasting colors seemed like a fun game to her.
meanings.sent4: For him, synaesthesis was a secret code where each sensation unlocked a new world.
meanings.sent5: The synaesthesis of the storm was like a painting coming to life before her eyes.
